column4: it comes with some nice apps, but those can all be installed onto gnome as well

is that the only way?
I'd rather have them as real users on the system...
with home dir's , etc
oh so u need motorola mobile phone tools
which is for windows..
maybe mobile phone tools will run on wine
motorola V3
(RAZR)
That's right, unless they sit down at the computer.  They could then log in.
so the only ways in are ftp, telnet and ssh
Whoa, you have telnet enabled for remote login?
why does everyone scream at me for that?
I'm not screaming; I'm mostly confused.
I'm saying that SSH can be used to remotely log in, so long as you have an SSH client on the other side.
Well, okay; anyone on that network, or anyone eavesdropping on a nearby network, can read your passwords.
You select text to copy.  Then you right-click to paste.
Anyway, we're veering off topic.  What was your original question?
In KDE, are they also too big when you do *not* use the NVidia driver?
no
Because you need to run 'esd'.
